Check out this story on northjersey.com: http://northjersy.news/2iAQ4xy\nCancelSend\nA link has been sent to your friend's email address.\nPosted!\nA link has been posted to your Facebook feed.\nJoin the Conversation\nTo find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs\nStore opens at Ridgewood site eyed for development\nMark Krulish , Staff Writer, @Mark_Krulish 7:49 p.m. ET Jan. 15, 2017\nMarie Albert Patio & Home Furnishings store is located in Ridgewood in the former Ken Smith dealership.\n(Photo: Marion Brown/NorthJersey.com)\nRIDGEWOOD \u2014 The site of a\u00a0former car dealership is once again a hub of commercial activity while an application before the village\u00a0Planning Board, which would radically\u00a0alter the property, awaits approval.\nIt has been nearly 4\u00bd years since Ken Smith Motors shuttered its doors after more than 60 years in business at its\u00a0iconic\u00a0prominent location on Franklin Avenue next to the railroad underpass.\nBut now, customers whose destination is 15 Franklin Ave. will find a full-blown furniture and outdoor patio store called Marie Albert Home\u00a0\u2014 a marked change from its previous use and something of a rarity for a suburban downtown business district in North Jersey.\nThe showroom building has mostly sat dormant since the dealership's\u00a0closing, save for its use as a campaign headquarters for local businessman Paul Vagianos and his running mate, Christine Ordway, in their unsuccessful bid for the state Assembly in 2015.\nLiz Scaduto, the owner of Marie Albert Home, said she is aware the property is slated for development, but\u00a0her store's location is not temporary \u2014 although\u00a0she was\u00a0not at\u00a0liberty to discuss the details of the lease.\n\"We're here to stay,\" said Scaduto.\nIt's unclear what the new lease might indicate about the owner's intentions for the property. An official from MCP Real Estate and Investment Management, the initial registering agent for owner KS Broad Street\u00a0LLC, was\u00a0unwilling to speculate about the future of the property.\nThe proposal for multifamily housing at the\u00a0Ken Smith Motors site has changed over the course of the long rezoning process, which has spanned several\u00a0years and has been the subject of countless public meetings.\nThe initial pitch to the Planning Board in January 2013\u00a0called for a 114-unit luxury apartment complex dubbed\u00a0Ridgewood Station.\u00a0These details were unveiled as part of a master plan amendment application to change the zoning of several downtown parcels to allow for multifamily housing.\nHowever, the applicant, Dinallo Construction Corp., backed out of the public hearing process in December 2013. Zoning ordinances were adopted by the Planning Board in June 2015 and by the previous Village Council in March 2016. Although the ordinances are the subject of a lawsuit, the hearings with the board will move forward as scheduled.\nRepresentatives from KS Broad Street\u00a0appeared before the Planning Board on Oct. 4. At that meeting, plans for a 50-foot tall, 66-unit complex with first-floor retail were revealed. The matter is slated to be heard next on Tuesday.\nThe village collected nearly $124,800 in property taxes in 2016 for the lots that make up 9-17 Franklin Avenue. That is not expected to change significantly with the addition of the business.\n"]]
[["name", "new_7/1738.html"], ["url", "http://www.northjersey.com/story/news/hudson/secaucus/2017/01/15/family-fun-fair-delights-young-and-old/96614920/"], ["text", "Family Fun Fair delights young and old\nCommerford's Kids Fun Fair and Zoo draws people to the Meadowlands Exposition Center\nPost to Facebook\nFamily Fun Fair delights young and old Commerford's Kids Fun Fair and Zoo draws people to the Meadowlands Exposition Center Check out this story on northjersey.com: http://northjersy.news/2jNKEx0\nCancelSend\nA link has been sent to your friend's email address.\nPosted!\nA link has been posted to your Facebook feed.\nJoin the Conversation\nTo find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs\nFamily Fun Fair delights young and old\nKaitlyn Kanzler , Staff Writer, @KaitlynKanzler8 7:37 p.m. ET Jan. 15, 2017\nPeople had the opportunity to get up close and personal with all kinds of animals during the Commerford's Kids Fun Fair and Zoo on Sunday at the Meadowlands Exposition Center.\n(Photo: Kaitlyn Kanzler/NorthJersey.com)\nOn the same weekend that the Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus announced that it would shut down in May, North Hudson residents were mingling with the same sorts of animals that were once a staple of the Greatest Show on Earth.\nShrieks of delight could be heard and the scent\u00a0of farm animals filled the air Sunday at the\u00a0Commerford's Kids Fun Fair and Zoo at the Meadowlands Exposition Center in Secaucus.\nThe event, which began Saturday, offered rides, games and up-close-and-personal encounters\u00a0with a variety of animals, including elephants and camels. It continues on Monday.\nKaitlyn Poskay, of Oradell, brought her 3-year old daughter, Victoria, niece Madison Drimones\u00a0of Lodi, and several other family members. Poskay's husband, Chris, said their daughter had received tickets from her school.\n\"The kids had fun,\" Poskay said, calling it a \"good Sunday activity. They loved it.\"\nThe fun fair and zoo opened on the same day that Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus announced it would perform its final show in May after 146 years. The iconic circus cited rising costs and declining ticket sales after removing elephants from show, under pressure from animals rights advocates, as reasons for the shutdown.\nWhile not a replacement for a circus, Poskay said the format of the\u00a0Commerford's Kids Fun Fair and Zoo allowed\u00a0children to interact with animals rather than providing passive entertainment. Poskay added that she felt\u00a0bad that some of the animals were in cages. Maricel Valle\u00a0of Bloomfield, who came to the exposition center with her husband and two daughters, Audrey and Leanne, said the fair was good for children because it allowed\u00a0them to learn about different kinds of animals from various countries. The menagerie included zebras, camels, kangaroos and ring-tailed lemurs to sheep, goats and donkeys.\n"]]
[["name", "new_7/1745.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/stress-heart-attack_us_5877afeae4b05b7a465e39b4?ir=Healthy+Living"], ["text", "How Stress Can Cause A Heart Attack\nHeightened activity in the brain's fear center may set off a chain of dangerous physiological responses.\n01/12/2017 05:45 pm ET\nCarolyn Gregoire Senior Writer, The Huffington Post\nmikkelwilliam via Getty Images\nA stressful, high-octane lifestyle is probably one of the worst things you can do for your heart, and cardiologists now have a better understanding of why.\u00a0\nIn a large-scale longitudinal study, published Wednesday in the medical journal The Lancet , a team of cardiologists at Harvard University and Massachusetts General Hospital found that stress increases heart attack risk by way of an overactive amygdala in the brain.\nThe amygdala is the brain\u2019s fear center. The small, almond-shaped region in the temporal lobe lights up in reaction to fear, anxiety, stress or anything else that signals a potential threat (real or perceived). A healthy amygdala can help to protect the brain against stress, while an amygdala that\u2019s hyper-excitable as a result of chronic stress or other factors can amplify the stress response . \u00a0\nThe new study shows, for the first time,\u00a0how an overactive amygdala can cause heart attack and stroke. When stress triggers the amygdala, it activates bone marrow and inflammation of the arteries to create the conditions for a heart attack.\u00a0\n\u201cOur results provide a unique insight into how stress may lead to cardiovascular disease,\u201d Dr. Ahmed Tawakol, a Harvard cardiologist and the study\u2019s lead author, said in a statement . \u201cThis raises the possibility that reducing stress could produce benefits that extend beyond an improved sense of psychological well-being.\u201d\u00a0\nFor the study, 293 people over age 30, all without heart problems, were measured for brain activity, bone marrow activity and inflammation of the arteries.\u00a0The researchers followed the participants for four years, from 2005 to 2008, during which time 22 participants experienced serious cardiac events.\u00a0\nParticipants with more active amygdalas (as determined by the initial brain scans) were more likely to have a cardiac event over the course of the study period, and were more likely to develop heart problems sooner than those with less active amygdalas.\u00a0\n\u201cEventually, chronic stress could be treated as an important risk factor for cardiovascular disease.\" Dr. Ahmed Tawakol\nInflammation is known to create blockages in the arteries, which can cut off blood flow to the heart,\u00a0while bone marrow activity has been linked to blood clots \u2015 another known risk factor for heart attacks.\u00a0\nIn a small sub-study, 13 patients with a history of PTSD had their stress levels assessed by psychology, and underwent brain scans and tests of inflammation levels. Those with the highest stress levels showed the greatest amygdala activity, and also showed more signs of inflammation.\u00a0\n\u201cEventually, chronic stress could be treated as an important risk factor for cardiovascular disease, which is routinely screened for and effectively managed like other major cardiovascular disease risk factors,\u201d\u00a0Tawakol said.\u00a0\nWhen advising patients on heart attack prevention, cardiologists typically focus on things like diet, smoking, alcohol consumption and physical activity. The new findings suggest that stress management should be considered as a preventative health measure as well.\u00a0\n\u201cIn the past decade, more and more individuals experience psychosocial stress on a daily basis. Heavy workloads, job insecurity, or living in poverty are circumstances that can result in chronically increased stress,\u201d Dr. Ilze Bot, a biopharmaceutical researcher at Leiden University in the Netherlands, wrote in a comment published alongside the study. \u201cThese clinical data establish a connection between stress and cardiovascular disease, thus identifying chronic stress as a true risk factor for acute cardiovascular syndromes.\u201d\u00a0\nSo, if you work in a high-pressure environment or find yourself frequently under stress, consider taking up meditation , yoga , tai chi or other research-backed stress busters to keep your heart healthy. There\u2019s a good chance that if your doctor isn\u2019t already recommending these practices, she will be after seeing the results of this study.\u00a0\nThis reporting is brought to you by HuffPost\u2019s health and science platform, The Scope. Like us on\u00a0 Facebook \u00a0and\u00a0 Twitter \u00a0and tell us your story:\u00a0 scopestories@huffingtonpost.com .\u00a0\nAlso on HuffPost\nMantras And Quotes To Keep Your Mind Off Stress\nMantras And Quotes To Keep Your Mind Off Stress\n1\n"]]
[["name", "new_7/1757.html"], ["url", "http://www.northjersey.com/story/news/passaic/wayne/2017/01/14/wayne-mayor-calls-affordable-housing-quota-atrocious/96503478/"], ["text", "Affordable-housing quota 'atrocious,' Wayne mayor says\nTownship officials said they are trying to expand affordable housing, but so far, unsuccessfully.\nPost to Facebook\nAffordable-housing quota 'atrocious,' Wayne mayor says Township officials said they are trying to expand affordable housing, but so far, unsuccessfully. Vergano, during the Jan. 4 reorganization meeting, said the affordable-housing mandates are the township's biggest challenge.\n(Photo: Adam Anik/NorthJersey.com)\nWayne currently has 940 Affordable Housing units - 70 percent designated senior housing\nWayne proposed a 185-unit 100 percent affordable housing development on Route 23 near West Belt\nWAYNE\u00a0\u2014 Township officials said they\u00a0are trying to expand affordable housing, but so far,\u00a0unsuccessfully.\nDespite\u00a0multiple plans submitted to the Council on Affordable Housing (COAH), approval has not yet been granted, said the officials.\nDuring his state of the township speech this month,\u00a0Mayor Chris\u00a0Vergano\u00a0called\u00a0the state's quota of affordable housing\u00a0the township is expected to meet\u00a0\u201catrocious.\u201d\nWayne must create 2,271 new affordable-housing units, including the rehabilitation of several existing units, according to\u00a0master plan documents from 2008\u00a0under round three of COAH regulations. COAH regulates the amount of income-restricted housing municipalities are required to have.\nVergano\u00a0said the COAH mandates are the township's biggest challenge. He said every\u00a0other New Jersey town is facing a similar challenge.\u00a0\"Our commitment is to come back with a plan this year, which we\u2019ve been working on for a long time now.\"\n"]]

[["name", "new_7/1768.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2017/01/14/workplace-stress-a-better-9-to-5_n_14002408.html"], ["text", "Workplace Stress Be Gone! How To Deal With Pressure In Healthy Ways\nThe Huffington Post Canada \u00a0|\u00a0 By Kayla Greaves\nreddit\nADVERTISEMENT\nIt's 10 a.m ... You've barely gotten through your breakfast before it's gone cold, there are a dozen emails you need to reply to within the next hour and you've got a to-do list from here 'til the end of time \u2014 it's going to be a seriously stressful work day.\nBut while you may feel like you're up to your neck with impending tasks, there are still ways to positively combat your work woes.\nAvoiding caffeine and sugar, drinking tea and eating B vitamin-rich foods are all great ways to fight stress and keep your nerves calm until you've survived the day.\nWatch the video above to find out more tips.\nWhat are some ways you get through a stressful work day? Let us know in the comments below.\n\u201cA Better 9-To-5\u201d is a new series from HuffPost Canada Studios that aims to help you make the most of your work day. Each episode offers tips, tricks and life hacks you can use at the office to increase your productivity and well-being. From asking your boss for a raise to taking care of your constantly-sitting body to keeping your desk germ-free, this is adulting at work made easy.\nAlso on HuffPost:\n7 Tips for Managing Work Stress When You Get Home\nof\n\ue000\n\ue001\nYou can't rehash every annoyance or major problem with your partner every day or all you will do is sound like you're constantly complaining.    Be selective about which story you want to share and which experiences you will keep to yourself.\nEveryone should have a chance to get in the door and unwind from their own stress at work before being hit with a laundry list of their partner's issues. So don't walk in the door complaining.   Come in, change clothes, decompress and use that time to calm down and consider what things should be shared and which ones should not.\nLimit the amount of time you discuss what's stressing you. You have so little time to spend with your partner after work so don't spend it all complaining about problems. Sometimes we have rolling conversations about stressful things throughout the night.   You bring it up as soon as you get home, then again during dinner, then after dinner, and then again in bed. Have the conversation once and avoid revisiting it unless absolutely necessary.\nSpend as much time talking about non-stressful things or being affectionate as you spend stressing out.   You want to leave your partner with a positive feeling about you, instead of with a knot in their stomach.\nIf you want your partner to listen to you when you're sharing your concerns, then be sure to listen to your partner when they're sharing theirs.   Things will go better if you make eye contact and nod or comment to show agreement or react to what they're sharing. Listening while staring at the TV or reading your mobile device will make your partner feel ignored.\nOur significant others tend to be our best friends, and so we want to tell them everything that we go through both personally and professionally.   Sometimes we don't realize when that is becoming overwhelming or just too much info in too little time.    If you have a good friend, sometimes you can decide to share with that person and not bring your every concern home to your partner.\nSo many of us are glued to our phones and computers but at some point we need to disconnect for the night and relax, especially when you need time for yourself and to spend time with your spouse and kids.   You can't keep taking calls and reading emails through dinner, in the bathroom, in the bed and in the middle of a bedtime story. Choose a cutoff time to put your phone to bed and/or limit the amount of time you spend on the phone/computer so that you have time to take care of home.  I know everyone needs to do what it takes to keep their jobs, but at the same time you won't be successful at work if you're falling apart from stress and your home life is crumbling around you.   When you get home from work, try to manage your time and communications about work in a balanced way so that you can use your time at home to relax and recharge, not just rehash the day and keep the stress going.\n\ue002 Share\n"]]

[["name", "new_7/1774.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.in/2016/07/04/ayurveda-superfoods_n_10799336.html"], ["text", "7 Ayurvedic Superfoods You Should Eat Every Day\n04/07/2016 3:06 PM IST | Updated 15/07/2016 8:27 AM IST\nAashmita Nayar Lifestyle editor, HuffPost India\nNEW! HIGHLIGHT AND SHARE\nHighlight text to share via Facebook and Twitter\nanand purohit via Getty Images\nThe 'tulsi' plant or Indian basil is an important symbol in the Hindu religious tradition. Scientific Name: Ocimum tenuiflorum, also known as Holy Basil\nADVERTISEMENT\nWhen it comes to embracing the benefits of Ayurveda, watching what you eat is possibly the best way to start. \u201cAhar (meaning dietary habits in Ayurveda) says that food eaten should have at least one of six tastes: sweet, sour, salty, bitter, pungent and astringent,\u201d says Dr Rahul Dogra of the Kairali Ayurvedic Group , an institution that has been dedicated to Ayurvedic research and healthcare for over two decades. \u201cThe right foods promote sattva (purity), detox the body, and rejuvenate it as well, leading to an overall increase in immunity, physical and mental strength, and digestion.\"\nIf you are seeking to accomplish all of the above, say goodbye to temporary crash diets, and instead consume the Ayurvedic superfoods listed below. Bonus: The best part is that they are easily available!\n1. Ginger\nAnother reason to drink more masala chai! Ginger is a well-recognised anti inflammatory that stimulates appetite, and reduces intestinal pain, gas and bloating . \u201cIn Ayurveda, fresh ginger is used to battle nausea, especially pregnancy-induced vomiting. Dried ginger root works well on joint pains (mix with almond oil and rub on painful areas), as well as migraines, and helps lower cholesterol levels,\u201d says Dr Dogra, who is an Ayurvedic physician at the Kairali Ayurvedic Centre.\n2. Ashwagandha Root (Indian ginseng)\nDabur\u2019s Chyawanprash, an integral component of every Indian\u2019s childhood, contains this super-food along with 39 other essential herbs. Ashwagandha is popularly used in Ayurveda for fighting stress, anxiety and fatigue. Also used to relieve painful swelling or rheumatoid arthritis -- traditionally its leaves were applied to the painful area -- Ashwangandha is also considered beneficial for increasing sperm count in men .\n3. Amla\nPopularly known as the Indian gooseberry, this fruit has carved its own healthcare niche on account of its powerful antioxidant properties. \u201cIt also works as a digestive tonic, cleansing the colon, and removes excess heat from the body,\u201d says Dr Dogra. A rich source of natural Vitamin C and calcium, Amla is also known for its anti-ageing properties. Amla oil is directly applied to the hair as it fights dandruff.\n4. Turmeric\nCurrently trending as an international superfood , turmeric is an all rounder, thanks to its anti-viral, anti-bacterial, and anti-fungal properties. \u201cIt is used to treat skin conditions, detoxify the liver and is excellent for diabetics as it lowers blood sugar,\u201d says Dr Dogra. While it can be applied directly to treat wounds, it is very beneficial when ingested, preferably when mixed in milk with some black pepper and honey.\n5. Ghee\nHere\u2019s some good news for those who like a spoonful of ghee over their rice and vegetables. \u201cClarified butter (as ghee is also known) actually lowers cholesterol , thanks to its content of omega-3 fatty acids, and helps improve heart health,\u201d says Dr Dogra. It also helps maintain healthy eyesight and skin, and trumps carbs as an excellent source of energy.\n6. Tulsi\n\u201cIn Ayurveda, tulsi leaves, ginger and cardamom boiled in water make for a healing potion to treat sore throats, headaches and chest congestion,\u201d says Dr Dogra. Tulsi juice is also effective in treating acne, as well as other skin disorders such as ring worm infections, rashes and itchiness. Regular consumption of tulsi also helps purify the blood, reduce blood sugar and build immunity.\n7. Brahmi\n\u201cBrahmi or Bacopa is used to balance the three body types specified in Ayurveda: Vata, Pitta and Kapha,\u201d says Dr Dogra, adding that this herb also helps sustain brain and nervous system functions. \u201cIt is traditionally mixed with sesame oil, and used to massage away stress and soothe the nerves,\u201d he says. Brahmi also helps improve memory power. Dr Dogra cautions though, that the herb should be consumed only after medical consultation. \"It does feature a few side-effects like stomach upsets, cramps and nausea,\" he says.\n"]]
[["name", "new_7/1781.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2017/01/12/nutella-cancer-risk_n_14136584.html"], ["text", "Nutella Ingredient, Palm Oil, May Cause Cancer: Study\nThe Huffington Post Canada \u00a0|\u00a0 By Maham Abedi\nADVERTISEMENT\nEvery jar of Nutella starts with 56 roasted hazelnuts \u2014 and apparently cancer-causing palm oil.\nAccording to the European Food Safety Authority, a recent study found palm oil was linked to an aggressive spread of cancer in mice. The oil is essential to Nutella's smooth texture and shelf life.\nNutella on the shelves of a supermarket in U.K. (Photo:  Simon Dawson/Bloomberg via Getty Images)\nFood companies in Italy have already begun boycotting the oil. Several supermarkets, including the country's largest grocery store chain Coop, are also removing palm oil products , according to The Independent.\nFerrero, the company that owns Nutella and is one of Italy's best-known food brands, isn't planning any recipe changes.\n\u201cMaking Nutella without palm oil would produce an inferior substitute for the real product, it would be a step backward ,\u201d Ferrero top exec Vincenzo Tapella told Reuters.\nThe company uses about 185,000 tonnes of palm oil a year, so switching to another oil would not be easy. Palm oil is the cheapest vegetable oil and costs about US$800 a ton, while sunflower oil, for example, costs US$845.\nNutella is sold across the world. (Photo: Stefano Rellandini/Reuters)\nWhile the food safety authority raised concerns about the oil, it says the level of risk is unclear and more research is needed. It stopped short of recommending a boycott.\nNutella isn't the only delicious product that's made with the oil in question. Chocolate bars, ice cream, cookies and pizza dough also contain palm oil, according to the World Wildlife Organization.\nSo, Nutella may not be the healthiest product in the grocery store. Though researchers aren\u2019t in total agreement about what specifically causes that boost, medical professionals recommend exercise as a way to lift spirits. For help with decision making, planning and learning new information, a Harvard Medical School study suggests making exercise a top priority.   Photo Credit: Shutterstock\n\u201cRegular physical activity can help keep your thinking, learning, and judgment skills sharp as you age,\u201d reports the CDC and they\u2019re not alone in their findings,  scientific studies point to exercise as a way to improve memory and brain health in older adults. In an age when Alzheimer\u2019s is a big concern and researchers are finding that physical activity may help, exercise is as important as ever for older adults and it\u2019s never too late to start. Photo Credit: Shutterstock Click Here to See Ways Exercise Can Improve Your Mental Health\nFrom spelling and vocabulary tests to recalling names, memory is a major part of life from elementary school through adulthood and research suggests that exercise can help with recall. Even prior to the publication of that study, though, The New York Times reported on earlier studies that showed a correlation between exercise and better memory.  Photo Credit: Shutterstock\nIf you\u2019re having trouble thinking \u201coutside the box\u201d a tough run or strength training session might just be the answer to your creativity block. A number of studies on the subject have shown that physical activity improves creative thinking, for a couple of hours after exercise. [["name", "new_7/1787.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.in/2016/06/27/menopause-india-_n_10693698.html"], ["text", "Women As Young As 29 Are Hitting Menopause In India: Report\n27/06/2016 12:21 PM IST | Updated 15/07/2016 8:27 AM IST\nBetwa Sharma Politics Editor, HuffPost India\nNEW! HIGHLIGHT AND SHARE\nHighlight text to share via Facebook and Twitter\nmarekuliasz via Getty Images\nmenopause - isolated word in vintage wood letterpress printing blocks stained by color inks\nADVERTISEMENT\nAn increasingly hectic lifestyle combined with changing food habits and other factors which increase stress is causing women in India to hit menopause as early as 29-years-of-age.\nA recent survey conducted by The Institute for Social and Economic Change said that four precent of women experience menopause between 29 and 34-years-of-age, and this figure goes up to eight percent in the 35-to-39 age group, The Hindu reported today.\nThe average age of hitting menopause is 51 around the world.\nShobha Gupta, Medical Director and IVF specialist at Mother\u2019s Lap IVF Centre, identified Premature Ovarian Failure (POF),  a condition when the ovaries stop functioning normally before the age of 40, as a culprit. \"POF is caused by changing food habits, work culture with increased stress are some of the reasons,\u201d Gupta told The Hindu .\n\u201cA woman\u2019s body is going through so many changes today because of the atmosphere and lifestyle requirements, which is why we have been seeing cases of premature ovary failure in young adults. It is better to plan a family on time, and if you have any medical issues then you should consult your doctor soon,\" she told the newspaper.\nDoctors say that symptoms of early menopause are the same as natural menopause which includes periods, hot flashes, mood swings, crying spells and sleeplessness.\nAnubha Singh, infertility expert from Shantah IVF Centre, told The Hindu that \"lifestyle choices such as  smoking, drinking, thyroid or auto-immune diseases, exposure to radiation like chemotherapy or radiotherapy, and poor nutrition can also cause premature menopause.\"\nNote: An earlier version of this story carried additional remarks by Dr. Shobha Gupta and Dr. Anubha Singh which are available at The Hindu .\nAlso on HuffPost India\n11 Questions Women Have About Their Periods\n11 Questions Women Have About Their Periods\n1\n"]]

[["name", "new_7/1794.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.in/2016/06/06/desi-vegetable-smoothie_n_10317266.html"], ["text", "6 Yummy Desi Vegetable Smoothies\n06/06/2016 4:32 PM IST | Updated 15/07/2016 8:27 AM IST\nAashmita Nayar Lifestyle editor, HuffPost India\nNEW! HIGHLIGHT AND SHARE\nHighlight text to share via Facebook and Twitter\nRakhee Vaswani\nADVERTISEMENT\nAs much as the word \u2018lauki\u2019 or \u2018paalak\u2019 makes us grimace and stick our tongues out, we still have to eat them because they are so amazing for our bodies. Luckily for us, Mumbai-based chef Rakhee Vaswani, who recently launched her children's book \u2018Picky Eaters,\u2019 has figured out 6 yummy ways to enjoy and savour these vegetables.\nIf you can\u2019t find a way to actually fry, broil or overwhelm these vegetables with calorie-heavy condiments and cheese, then simply drink them! Just throw them in a blender with other power packed super foods (mentioned below) and hit churn.\nA picky eater herself, Vaswani claims to have hated these veggies as a child, but eventually took to preparing them in a way that appealed to her palate. \u201cThe same,\u201d she says,\u201capplies to everybody else. Simply find a way to enjoy them.\u201d\nHere are six smoothies that\u2019ll kick-start healthier mornings and do away with those evenings when lauki for dinner made you groan. .\nLAUKI AND TINDA SMOOTHIE\nChopped bottle gourd (Lauki): 1/2 cup;\nChopped apple gourd (Tinda): 1/2 cup;\nWater:1/4 cup;\nBlack pepper powder: 1 pinch;\nRoasted cumin powder: 1 pinch;\nLemon juice (optional): a dash\nMethod\nTo prepare a healthy smoothie, taste a slice of lauki to ensure it is not bitter.\nNow put first 3 ingredients into the blender and blend until smooth.\nTransfer to glass then add a pinch of salt, black pepper and cumin powders and stir to enhance the taste.\nMATTAR SMOOTHIE\nGreen peas: 50 gm (blanched);\nPear: 1 number;\n"]]
[["name", "new_7/1798.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2017/01/04/get-fit-home-exercise-2mtt-body-break_n_13939554.html"], ["text", "Get Fit At Home With Hal Johnson And Joanne McLeod From 'Body Break'\nThe Huffington Post Canada\nreddit\nADVERTISEMENT\nIf you'd rather work out at home instead of hitting the gym, that doesn't mean you're lazy: you might just be ahead of the curve.\nAfter all, your home has nearly everything you need for a basic workout according to Canadian fitness duo Hal Johnson and Joanne McLeod.\nThe \" Body Break \" stars say while gyms can be motivating, home workouts provide fewer hiccups. So to save time, money and make things convenient, Johnson and McLeod say focus your workouts on strength and cardio, not fancy pieces of equipment found at gyms.\nFor how you can get creative with your fitness routines at home, check out the video above . How do you stay fit at home? Let us know in the comments below.\n\" 2 Minutes To Transform \" is your guide to small but meaningful changes for a better you. Experts share their tips to transform your life at home, in the office or while you're on the go -- all in under two minutes.\nRelated on HuffPost:\nExercises that Show Results After One Workout\nof\n\ue000\n\ue001\nIf there is one exercise that will bring the fastest results with the minimal amount of time, it is Plyometrics, also known as jump training, Brown says. \u201cAs long as you get low enough and you propel yourself up, you\u2019re going to start seeing a lot more development in your glutes and thighs. The muscles exert maximum force in short intervals of time. Jumping jacks of other jumps in combination with lunges (if you do them correctly) and hamstring exercises for a more advanced workout. Another \u201ckiller combination\u201d is 25 jump squats, 25 burpees, 25 jump lunges.  Photo Credit:  Shutterstock  Click Here to See Exercises that Show Results After One Workout\n\u201cOne leg is stronger than two halves of legs,\u201d Brown says. This is called \u201cbilateral deficit.\u201d It\u2019s completely counter-intuitive, she adds, but it works very effectively. Single-leg (Romanian) deadlifts while holding 8-12lbs dumbbells, or a Bulgarian split squat, will show a lot of definition really quickly, especially in your thighs, Brown says.  Photo Credit: Shutterstock\nPeople may not see results immediately, but they will definitely feel a change, Brown says. Done with proper technique, kettlebell swings and Goblet squats, while holding a kettlebell will challenge you. Your hamstrings, glutes and inner thighs are guaranteed to be sore for a few days. The swings, which are a high-intensity move, work your entire backside, making it look more toned.  Photo Credit: Shutterstock  Click Here to See Exercises that Show Results After One Workout\nFor flat abs, try crunches or other ab exercises that you normally do while sitting on a Bosu Ball. \u201cYou will feel the difference right away,\u201d Brown says. There is going to be definition on your abdominal muscles within a week, especially if you are a thin person. Your muscles are working harder than normal because you have to balance yourself on an unstable surface to sculpt your core and tone your muscles.  Photo Credit: Shutterstock\nTRX programs are a good example of effective functional training, Brown says. It focuses on strength exercises that increase endurance and flexibility so your body has a wide range of motion. There are some very difficult exercises, but the least you can do is a chest press. TRX chest presses are like pushups on cables.   Click Here to See Exercises that Show Results After One Workout  Photo Credit: Shutterstock\n\ue002 Share\n"]]
[["name", "new_7/1799.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.in/2016/05/03/kota-collector-letter_n_9825674.html"], ["text", "A Worried District Collector In Kota Has Penned An Emotional Letter To Parents Of IIT Aspirants\n03/05/2016 9:10 AM IST | Updated 15/07/2016 8:26 AM IST\nRituparna Chatterjee Front page editor, HuffPost India\nNEW! HIGHLIGHT AND SHARE\nHighlight text to share via Facebook and Twitter\nASSOCIATED PRESS\nIn this Thursday, Aug. 5, 2010 photograph, students copy what the teacher writes on the board at a cram school in Kota, India. Every year, more than 450,000 students take the Indian Institutes of Technology (IIT) exam, hoping for entry to the hallowed public engineering institutes located across India. Slightly more than 13,000 passed in 2010, a 3 percent success rate. (AP Photo/Saurabh Das)\nADVERTISEMENT\nOne can only imagine the pressure that forced 17-year-old Kriti Tripathi to choose death over engineering. The Rajasthan-based girl jumped to her death last week even after cracking the IIT-JEE because she did not want to pursue a career in engineering, according to the police. There are many students in India who face the same burden of expectations and have no one to turn to for emotional support.\nThe Hindustan Times reported that Tripathi's death was the fifth suicide by a student this year, and at least 56 others enrolled to the Kota coaching centres that train candidates for various entrance exams, have killed themselves in the last five years.\nWorried at this trend, a conscientious district collector of the city in Rajasthan has written an open letter to parents to let their children be, learn from them and encourage them to look at alternate career options that will help bring out their true potential.\nRavi Kumar Surpur told Telegraph that the letter was part of \"the multiple interventions we are trying to do to ease the situation that has arisen because of the constant stress and competitiveness the students face in the run-up to the actual examinations\".\n\"Doing it through the age-old classical letter seemed the best option to us,\" he said.\nAre we interested in making the child realise 'Your Dreams' at any cost or should it be like creating such situations that the child realises 'His/Her' Dreams?\n\"Are we interested in making the child realise 'Your Dreams' at any cost or should it be like creating such situations that the child realises 'His/Her' Dreams?\" Surpur asked in the thought-provoking letter.\nHere's the full text of the letter.\nDear Parents,\nOn behalf of Kota City, I take this opportunity to welcome your child to a city of wonders which processes the young minds of this country and fuels their passion to become the architects of Modern India.\nMy humble request at the beginning of this letter is to read this with some patience and time and it would be ideal if both the parents can read this together.\nIt is the dream of every parent to see his child touch the pinnacles of success and reach places which only few can afford. Every parent plants a seed in the mind of the child which over a period of time bears fruits but after careful nourishment and tendering since the seed is so tender that any mishandling may fail us from realizing our dream.\nIt is a very difficult situation for parents to leave their child in a place where they do not live and things become still difficult when the purpose for which the child is left behind is for dedicated and committed efforts in scaling excellence in education.\nWhen parents look at the huge billboard signage/hoarding/ newspaper clips depicting pictures of young beautiful children who have achieved what they dream for their child, the resolution to inspire and motivate their children becomes still stronger.\nGood career in the field of Engineering & Medicine, as the case may be, is more or less like certain insurance in terms of decent earning and living standards. I sincerely think that in most of the cases, this is the very reason that makes us dream such careers for our children.\nThere is nothing wrong in thinking on a certain kind of Assured Career Insurance for one's child since limited resources and high degree of competition demands one to think ahead of times.\nHowever, I think we all agree that the World too has changed drastically in the last 15-20 years so much so, that most of the facilities and services that were available for a limited few are now available to many due to the huge progress in technology which was witnessed in this period.\nArt, Entertainment, Professional Sports, Literature, Health & Fitness, Entrepreneurship, Journalism, Photography, Event management, Music, Adventure, Destination tourism, etc, to name a few too witnessed immense growth in comparison to the bygone era.\nMany of these even created a new niche which not just nurtured creative potential of the human mind and its capabilities but also were very successful career options.\nWell, the point is not about asking you to see them as better options but certainly to see them also as options.\nIt is a matter of fact that today, young children are facing immense amount of pressure relating to their academic performance and due to the same many of them go through various levels of stress.\nEven if we consider that a certain element of stress would exist in competition... parental support, care and the right kind of family situations would help the child to cope with any difficult situation.\nHowever, current reality is that due to the lack of right kind of conditions and support systems, many children are going through stress uncared and unattended for and in a few cases such situations disabled the children to such an extreme extent that they committed suicide...\nDon't get frightened suddenly as to what is being said about your child.... Your child is perfectly safe and sound and you have no reasons to worry, but you have reasons to have concern of your child which I believe you will understand as we read my letter further.\nI consider myself a very unfortunate person because I got a chance to read around 20-25 Suicide Notes of Young, Brilliant, Beautiful and Wonderful Children.\nAm I giving so many adjectives to such children because they committed Suicide?\nI am sorry.... Answer is No... They were in fact, as I said earlier, Young, Brilliant, Beautiful and Wonderful Children.\nA Girl with an amazing command of English language in her suicide note (grammatically perfect 5-page Suicide Note with beautiful running handwriting) thanks her mother for giving up her career for raising the children.... Subtle hint that she was pricked on this matter again and again.... Another girl wants her grandmother to become her mother in her next birth.... Another requests her parents to allow her younger sister to do what she likes and not what they like.... One tells candidly that he was manipulated to study science which was not his taste.... Many simply write in fewer lines that they could not fulfil the expectations of their parents.... Rather few say they were not really capable of doing what is being asked for by them.... All of them thought that Death was a much peaceful and effortless action than going through this dilemma of artificially doing what parents want them to do....\nAs they say \"Tip of the Iceberg\" reveals little and hides mountains within, similarly apparent Suicide Cases reflect numbers but reality or the hidden mountain is all those children who did not opt to take this extreme step but certainly are going through stress/worry/anxiety due to pressure on performance.\nMany Parents cannot believe after the disaster that it was their own child who took such a drastic measure and I don't mean to hurt their sentiments any further but the reality is that the child was mentally looking for some blade of grass which a drowning man searches for.... That blade of grass could have been your simple appreciation of his efforts... your solacing words of comforts of asking him to do his best and forget the results... your absolute unconditioned appreciation of his extraordinariness....\nIn return, what the child got was threats of performing still better...psychological manipulation by repeat and re-telecasting of the hardships you have gone through for the sake of family.... comparison with better performers (neighbors, relatives, children of colleague, ancestors...could be anyone)... sharing imagination on the loss/notional gain of social status being dependent on child's performance.\nWe need to understand that statistically speaking not many children commit suicide in comparison to the total number of children coping with such academic pressure if we analyze the numbers but life analysis tells us that their hopes and dreams are overlooked and hurt many a times.... So it is high time we pause and contemplate a bit...\nI need to take a pause here since I hear many of you saying kids do not like many things which are good for them.... So the question I tend to hear from you is... Should parents go children's immature ways? Not necessarily....\nWell let us try to see what all good things they resisted.... Eating right, sleeping right, talking right, behaving right, seeing right, listening right, reading right etc.\nChild actually observes parents and never follows anything blindly....\nMoreover there is one thing which is certain.... Child analyses and looks at the parents to see whether in case any of those things preached are followed by parents to begin with and if so.... Whether their parents are really loving, joyful, peaceful and happy by doing so....\nThey tend to pick up only those habits of their parents that make them happy and peaceful...\nIn case you have seriously messed up situations, your child may even not like you....\nIt may appear strange and extremely annoying.... But there is a possibility of your child not liking you.... This comes in many forms and shades.... Absolute dislike, not liking few traits of yours, not liking you by comparing you with someone better, not liking you for your over protective care and concern which you may think as love but is suffocating for the child, not liking you for your double standards (we may have...) etc.\nSo, is it the objective of this letter to make you realise that your child dislikes you?\nAnswer again is a big No.... Your child does not dislike you... I am just making a point that unconsciously we may have created such a situation, which we need to undo....\nChildren are parents' responsibility and we are no one to teach a parent their responsibility nor do we intend to do so.... Parents really think good for their children's future but the point I need to make is that your dreams are always limited to your experience of what is good... what is successful... what is the best thing.... Well, the truth is your child may surpass your imagination and reach places which you never even dreamed of....\nWe all come from different segments of the society in terms of social & economic status, culture, religion, belief systems etc. However as far the natural principle of upbringing a child is concerned they remain the same everywhere.\nI am not an expert in Parenting nor have many credentials in \"Right Child Care Practices\" and I fully understand that different kind of children need different kind of interventions yet I would request you to divert little attention to these fundamental aspects relating to child management.\nCreating the right kind of atmosphere for the child to grow and flower in home by making home a really happy, loving and peaceful place to live.\nUnderstanding the needs of the children... There are two extremes in this case... Making the child go through terrible hardships to realise \"Your\" dreams is one end and the other end is over-pampered care.... Both of them definitely do not work....\nTake time to switch from teaching mode to learning mode from the child since children show you the way to be really happy and peaceful at times...Instead of learning form them we tend to always assume the role of teacher/preacher...\nAllow the child \"to be\" on his own terms and here I mean especially the child's engagement with nature and world around and empower them with the right kind of communication skills which are more accommodative.... Interaction with the other gender due to their coming of age is not an aberration but a normal process, which you can keep a note on but not try to prevent it totally.\nSpend time with children without complaining of your office, life situation, problems, hardships all the time.... It may be really too late before you want to spend and there is no more time available with the child... Why? Because we may have made him just like ourselves in an effort to tutor him.... We certainly are not the benchmark for the child. Many a times, we may be regressive rudimentary types in comparison to the ability of the child.\nJust a final thought. Are we interested in making the child realise \"Your Dreams\" at any cost or should it be like creating such situations that the child realises \"His/Her\" Dreams?\nI could have simply attended a Parents Counselling Session during admission and spoken on these issues but usually it so happens that in such gatherings we are conditioned and influenced more by impression of the person sitting next to you or people who think different.\nNothing wrong in disagreeing but it is best to disagree on own terms instead of getting influenced by others.... Finally, I would like to tender my unconditional apology for taking your time and telling you things about Child Management in which I am no expert and my words in this letter have been gathered by my limited experience in Kota dealing with similar cases and certainly there are great men who have inspired me to put my thoughts before you....\nBe the Best Parent in the World!!!!\nI am sure there is no competition there...\nYours Sincerely\n"]]

eyed by developer\nFurniture store moves in at site slated for development\nPost to Facebook\nStore opens at Ridgewood site eyed by developer Furniture store moves in at site slated for development Check out this story on northjersey.com: http://northjersy.news/2iyBDdh\nCancelSend\nA link has been sent to your friend's email address.\nPosted!\nA link has been posted to your Facebook feed.\n1\nTo find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs\nStore opens at Ridgewood site eyed by developer\nMark Krulish , Staff Writer, @Mark_Krulish 1:56 a.m. ET Jan. 15, 2017\nMarie Albert Patio & Home Furnishings has moved into the former Ken Smith auto showroom in Ridgewood.\n(Photo: Marion Brown/NorthJersey.com)\n\u00a0\nRIDGEWOOD \u2014 The site of a\u00a0former car dealership is once again a hub of commercial activity while an application before the village\u00a0Planning Board, which would radically\u00a0alter the property, awaits approval.\nIt has been nearly 4 1/2 years since Ken Smith Motors shuttered its doors after more than 60 years in business at its\u00a0prominent location on Franklin Avenue next to the railroad underpass.\nBut now, customers whose destination is 15 Franklin Ave. will find a full-blown furniture and outdoor patio store called Marie Albert Home\u00a0\u2014 a marked change from its previous use and somewhat of a rarity for a suburban downtown business district in North Jersey.\nThe showroom building has mostly sat dormant since the dealership's\u00a0closing, save for its use as a campaign headquarters for local businessman Paul Vagianos and his running mate, Christine Ordway, in their unsuccessful bid for the state Assembly in 2015.\nLiz Scaduto, the owner of Marie Albert Home, said she is aware the property is slated for development, but\u00a0her store's location is not temporary \u2014 although\u00a0she was\u00a0not at\u00a0liberty to discuss the details of the lease.\n\"We're here to stay,\" said Scaduto.\nMarie Albert Patio & Home Furnishings store is located in Ridgewood in the former Ken Smith dealership.\n\u00a0(Photo: Marion Brown/NorthJersey.com)\nIt's unclear what the new lease might indicate about the owner's intentions for the property. An official from MCP Real Estate and Investment Management, the initial registering agent for owner KS Broad Street\u00a0LLC, was\u00a0unwilling to speculate about the future of the property.\nThe proposal for multifamily housing at the\u00a0Ken Smith Motors site has changed over the course of the long rezoning process, which has spanned several\u00a0years and has been the subject of countless public meetings.\nThe initial pitch to the Planning Board in January 2013\u00a0called for a 114-unit luxury apartment complex dubbed\u00a0Ridgewood Station.\u00a0These details were unveiled as part of a master plan amendment application to change the zoning of several downtown parcels to allow for multifamily housing.\nHowever, the applicant, Dinallo Construction Corp., backed out of the public hearing process in December 2013. Zoning ordinances were adopted by the Planning Board in June 2015 and by the previous Village Council in March 2016. Although the ordinances are the subject of a lawsuit, the hearings with the board will move forward as scheduled.\nRepresentatives from KS Broad Street\u00a0appeared before the Planning Board on Oct. 4. At that meeting, plans for a 50-foot tall, 66-unit complex with first-floor retail were revealed. The matter is slated to be heard next on Tuesday.\nThe village collected nearly $124,800 in property taxes in 2016 for the lots that make up 9-17 Franklin Avenue. That is not expected to change significantly with the addition of the business.\nCONNECT TWEET 6 LINKEDIN 1 COMMENTEMAILMORE\nRead or Share this story: http://northjersy.news/2iyBDdh\n"]]

[["name", "new_7/1820.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2016/12/21/ginger-benefits_n_13772842.html"], ["text", "Ginger Benefits: How This Little Root Can Work Wonders For Your Body\nThe Huffington Post Canada \u00a0|\u00a0 By                                                                                                                  Brian Vinh Tien Trinh\nPosted:\nreddit\nADVERTISEMENT\nThe holidays are a time when gingerbread men and houses reign supreme, but there are plenty of reasons to incorporate ginger into your diet all year round.\nLet's start with the winter season, when cold weather means more people stay indoors. Sharing a cozy couch with friends and family is great, but it's also a good opportunity to spread viruses and germs.\nIf you do feel like you got more than just socks from your Aunt Sue over the holidays, ginger can help you sweat out that cold. In addition to detoxification, ginger-induced sweats produce dermicidin . This germ-fighting agent can offer protection against invading bacteria and fungi, according to German researchers.\nIf you're looking to put a little spring in your step now that it's well, spring, count on ginger to be there whenever there are muscle aches. Just don't expect it to kick in immediately.\nA 2013 study from the American Pain Society found two grams of ginger taken daily for 11 days significantly reduced pain for people suffering from exercise-induced muscle soreness. So the next time you grab that bottle of water, add a few slices of ginger for good measure.\nSummer's prime time for training regiments, especially if you're a runner gunning for a personal best for an upcoming fall race. But all that training can take a toll on your joints. If you are detecting pain in your knees or ankles, introducing ginger to your diet can have some benefits.\nGinger contains gingerols, a collection of anti-inflammatory compounds, that block the chemical messenger that transmits the pain from inflammation to your body, according to the BBC.\nNow, not everyone's a marathon runner. Some of us are better suited for marathon of Netflix, or come fall and Thanksgiving, marathon eating. If you've found yourself biting off more than you can chew again, ginger can offer some relief.\nFor anyone who deals with indigestion, ginger can help speed up the process it takes to empty your stomach. Ginger also does double duty if you get bloated by functioning as a carminative. Carminatives help eliminate excess gas from the intestinal tract , according to Examine.com\nAnd last but not least, ginger is tasty. Ginger is popular in Asian cuisine as the spice pairs well with poultry, seafood and vegetables.\nBut don't take our word for it. Watch as Toronto chef Susur Lee whips up some of his guo tie , a dumpling dish that marries ginger with a medley of vegetables perfect for any occasion.\nRelated on HuffPost:\n"]]
[["name", "new_7/1826.html"], ["url", "http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2016/09/19/rage-yoga-like-a-tourist_n_12090726.html"], ["text", "Rage Yoga In Calgary Turns Everything You Know About Meditation Upside-Down\nThe Huffington Post Canada\nreddit\nADVERTISEMENT\nLindsay Istace is giving the middle finger to everything you think you know about yoga, meditation and the pursuit of zen.\nAnd she wants anyone else looking to flip the bird to join her through rage yoga.\n\"I love swearing, I love drinking, why don\u2019t I start my own yoga thing called 'rage yoga'?\" Istace said.\nThe 24-year-old founder of the practice eschews the peaceful music and bright yoga studios for a bar in downtown Calgary , chock full of heavy metal music and swearing.\nNot the typical image of mindfulness most would expect \u2014 including \" Like A Tourist \" host Dan Rodo and Calgarian Yeny Lara.\nThe two were on the pursuit of hidden gems across the city and decided to meet up with Istace at Dickens Pub.\nTo see the art in practice, check out the video above. And for more of cool things to do in Calgary, head here.\nFind More Of Canada's Hidden Gems With \" Like A Tourist \":\nWith files from Sarah Rieger\nRelated on HuffPost:\nMust Have Accessories for Your Yoga Retreat\nof\n\ue000\n\ue001\nAdidas by Stella McCartney Yoga Mat $100 at www.trendysportsusa.com  Designed by English fashion designer, Stella Nina McCartney, this is the most comfortable yoga mat you can possibly find anywhere.
